intro: Seriphidium mongolorum, commonly known as Mongolian wormwood, is a flowering plant native to central Asia, particularly Mongolia and parts of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its small yellow flowers are usually arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Seriphidium mongolorum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
